definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

sentences.english: In the face of more requests for waivers and refinancings, banks will react selectively .
sentences.chinese: 隨着銀行面臨更多放棄權利和再融資的要求。

sentences.english: At the same time, the central bank reduced refinancing and rediscount rate, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 同時，央行降低再融資和再貼現利率，等等。

sentences.english: The unit also refinances mortgages and makes home-equity loans.
sentences.chinese: 該部門也再融資抵押貸款和家庭資產貸款。

sentences.english: He did say that further Refi-rate cuts were not to be discounted.
sentences.chinese: 他還表示，歐洲央行或將進一步下調再融資利率水平。

sentences.english: Right offering is often a main re-financing means of listed companies in China.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，配股一直是上市公司股權再融資的主要手段。

sentences.english: The listed companies' financing or re-financing scales are also unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 上市公司在股市的融資和再融資規模也是無法預測的。

sentences.english: In addition, there is no re-financing needs of listed companies, are also not too interested.
sentences.chinese: 此外，也沒有再融資需求的上市公司，也不太感興趣。

sentences.english: The list of collateral for refinancing has been widened.
sentences.chinese: 再融資擔保品的範圍也得以擴大。

sentences.english: The final maturity for the amounts refinanced will be February 2011.
sentences.chinese: 這筆再融資貸款最後還款期將是2011年2月。

sentences.english: The refi applications index remains at least 40 percent below the peak seen last year.
sentences.chinese: 再融資貸款申請指數仍然比去年高峯時低至少40%。

definition: to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: (economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
(Tw) to lower (prices, interest rates etc)/to reduce/to cut
